repository.corpname: Digital Collections and Archives, Tufts University

custodhist.head: Custodial History
custodhist.p: Box 9 and 10 were added in March 2009 when found uncatalogued in the Special Collections ranges. Containing largely Slavery Documents material, two envelopes found separately were labeled accordingly and were added to box 9. These boxes were removed from Tisch 002 in January 2010 and placed in front of the first row of the DCA stacks.

processinfo.head: Processing Information
processinfo.p: When the boxes were moved, materials were re-housed for preservation purposes. Boxes were re-numbered in an attempt to indicate the original contents of individual boxes in Tisch 002. If the original box number was know, it was indicated in Collection Documentation. It is impossible to differentiate boxes 001-004 because the materials were all housed upright in records cartons, but inventory list indicates general content of boxes. A comprehensive finding aid exists for this collection.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: This collection contains original musical compositions, concert programs, correspondence and manuscripts of the Korean-American composer and musicologist, Donald Sur.

relatedmaterial.head: Related Materials
relatedmaterial.p: MS006 T. J. Anderson papers. Digital Collections and Archives, Tufts University, Medford, MA.

bioghist.head: Biographical / Historical
bioghist.p: Donald Sur (1935-1999) was a Korean-American composer and musicologist and a graduate of Harvard. Sur was born in Honolulu, Hawaii on February 1, 1935 to parents of Korean descent. His family moved to Los Angeles shortly after World War II. He completed his undergraduate studies at the University of California at Berkeley after transferring from UCLA. He completed graduate degrees at Princeton University and later at Harvard University in 1972 (PhD in composition). Sur is most well known for his composition the "Slavery Documents." In addition to musical composition, Sur also taught music courses at several universities in the Boston area, including Harvard, MIT, Tufts, Wellesley College and Boston University. He died of cancer on May 24, 1999 at the age of 64.

accessrestrict.head: Conditions Governing Access
accessrestrict.p: This collection is open for research. This collection may require review before it is available for use. Please contact DCA for further details.

userestrict.head: Conditions Governing Use
userestrict.p: Some material in this collection may be protected by copyright and other rights. Please see "Reproductions and Use" on the Digital Collections and Archives website for more information about reproductions and permission to publish. No documentation is available regarding the intellectual property rights in this collection.

accessrestrict.head: Conditions Governing Access
accessrestrict.p: Open for research. This series may require review before it is available for use. Please contact DCA for further details.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: This box contains the following scores: The Unicorn & the Lady, Violin Concerto, A Neo-Platonic Epistle, Dampierre, and Tango.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: This box contains notebooks with Sur's sheet music.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: This box contains Sur's notebooks from his time as a student at Harvard, as well as musical scores.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: This box contains Sur's musical scores: Satori on Park Avenue, Piano Fragments, Lacrimosa, and several others. Also included are Sur's personal correspondence, mail, financial papers, concert programs, and other papers.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: This box contains Sur's musical scores Khumdori Tansaeng, Prelude for Piano, Memory Fragments, Berceuse, Missa Tea for Two, Sonnet 97, Lacrimosa,Satori on Park Avenue, as well as music from other composers such as Beethoven and several unidentified manuscripts. Some annotations are in Korean.

did.unittitle: Music by other composers and Sur's personal papers

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: This box contains music by other composers (mostly reproductions), Sur's personal papers, and other music.
